attributes.action: Dismissal of Theresa May as Prime Minster appoint Kenneth Clark Prime Minster
attributes.additional_details: Scotland voted against Brexit and by pushing forward with Brexit the Prime Minster risks Scotland  leaving the United Kingdom and the loss of the United Kingdom permanent seat on the Security Council of the United Nations
attributes.background: We call for the dismissal of Theresa May as Prime Minster for unnecessarily spending  public  money on ligation and risking  the break up  of the United Kingdom and call for the appointment of Kenneth Clark as Prime Minster to form an interim coalition Government

rejection.details:
In any case, as you might already know, the Prime Minister of the UK is not chosen by the UK Government or Parliament.

After a general election, the Queen decides who to invite to form a Government. In practice, this is usually the leader of the political party that wins the most seats in a general election. You can find out more about this here:

http://www.royal.gov.uk/MonarchUK/QueenandGovernment/QueenandPrimeMinister.aspx
